text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/ef2dff52de52c17fe1bd7c06cbb32d8955901f5a|patch 8.2.2177: pattern "^" does not match if first character is comb…>
patch 8.2.2177: pattern "^" does not match if first character is combining

Problem:    Pattern "^" does not match if the first character in the line is
            combining. (Rene Kita)
Solution:   Do accept a match at the start of the line. (closes #6963)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.2177: pattern "^" does not match if first character is comb… · vim/vim@ef2dff5
attachments.title: patch 8.2.2177: pattern "^" does not match if first character is comb… · vim/vim@ef2dff5
attachments.text: …ining Problem: Pattern "^" does not match if the first character in the line is combining. (Rene Kita) Solution: Do accept a match at the start of the line. (closes #6963)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/6a78f328442073c32d58eafc13ce5a1ca7729eeb|patch 8.2.2176: crash with a sequence of fold commands>
patch 8.2.2176: crash with a sequence of fold commands

Problem:    Crash with a sequence of fold commands.
Solution:   Bail out when there are no folds at all.  Add a test (Dominique
            Pellé) (closes #7515)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.2176: crash with a sequence of fold commands · vim/vim@6a78f32
attachments.title: patch 8.2.2176: crash with a sequence of fold commands · vim/vim@6a78f32
attachments.text: Problem: Crash with a sequence of fold commands. Solution: Bail out when there are no folds at all. Add a test (Dominique Pellé) (closes #7515)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/9aff970204234193045cfee205d51e2393e93bfd|patch 8.2.2175: github actions: clang-11 handling suboptimal>
patch 8.2.2175: github actions: clang-11 handling suboptimal

Problem:    Github actions: clang-11 handling suboptimal.
Solution:   Separate step of installing clang-11. Get ubuntu release name
            dynamically. (Ozaki Kiichi, closes #7514)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.2175: github actions: clang-11 handling suboptimal · vim/vim@9aff970
attachments.title: patch 8.2.2175: github actions: clang-11 handling suboptimal · vim/vim@9aff970
attachments.text: Problem: Github actions: clang-11 handling suboptimal. Solution: Separate step of installing clang-11. Get ubuntu release name dynamically. (Ozaki Kiichi, closes #7514)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/8c9d98a8af5351a3ac98cf11dede9f0268461511|patch 8.2.2174: Mac version doesn't specify the CPU architecture>
patch 8.2.2174: Mac version doesn't specify the CPU architecture

Problem:    Mac version doesn't specify the CPU architecture.
Solution:   Add "arm64" or "x86_64". (Yee Cheng Chin, closes #7519)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.2174: Mac version doesn't specify the CPU architecture · vim/vim@8c9d98a
attachments.title: patch 8.2.2174: Mac version doesn't specify the CPU architecture · vim/vim@8c9d98a
attachments.text: Problem: Mac version doesn't specify the CPU architecture. Solution: Add "arm64" or "x86_64". (Yee Cheng Chin, closes #7519)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/5082471f91dd42ed8c35e0f649d0a6572e6fe3fc|patch 8.2.2172: Vim9: number of arguments is not always checked>
patch 8.2.2172: Vim9: number of arguments is not always checked

Problem:    Vim9: number of arguments is not always checked. (Yegappan
            Lakshmanan)
Solution:   Check number of arguments when calling function by name.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.2172: Vim9: number of arguments is not always checked · vim/vim@5082471
attachments.title: patch 8.2.2172: Vim9: number of arguments is not always checked · vim/vim@5082471
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: number of arguments is not always checked. (Yegappan Lakshmanan) Solution: Check number of arguments when calling function by name.

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/61e07b2394e12f757160cac421ec5c45dc4c074d|patch 8.2.2171: valgrind warning for using uninitialized value>
patch 8.2.2171: valgrind warning for using uninitialized value

Problem:    Valgrind warning for using uninitialized value.
Solution:   Do not use "startp" or "endp" unless there is a match.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.2171: valgrind warning for using uninitialized value · vim/vim@61e07b2
attachments.title: patch 8.2.2171: valgrind warning for using uninitialized value · vim/vim@61e07b2
attachments.text: Problem: Valgrind warning for using uninitialized value. Solution: Do not use "startp" or "endp" unless there is a match.

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/f112f30a82f17114d8b08a0fb90928cd19440581|patch 8.2.2170: Vim9: a global function defined in a :def function fails>
patch 8.2.2170: Vim9: a global function defined in a :def function fails

Problem:    Vim9: a global function defined in a :def function fails if it
            uses the context.
Solution:   Create a partial to store the closure context. (see #7410)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.2170: Vim9: a global function defined in a :def function fails · vim/vim@f112f30
attachments.title: patch 8.2.2170: Vim9: a global function defined in a :def function fails · vim/vim@f112f30
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: a global function defined in a :def function fails if it uses the context. Solution: Create a partial to store the closure context. (see #7410)
